# toolbar

**Instance Property**

The custom toolbar associated with the navigation controller.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var toolbar: UIToolbar! { get }
```

## Discussion

This property contains a reference to the built-in toolbar managed by the navigation controller. Access to this toolbar is provided solely for clients that want to present an action sheet from the toolbar. You should not modify the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIToolbar] object directly.

Management of this toolbar’s contents is done through the custom view controllers associated with this navigation controller. For each view controller on the navigation stack, you can assign a custom set of toolbar items using the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIViewController/setToolbarItems(_:animated:)] method of [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIViewController].

The visibility of this toolbar is controlled by the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UINavigationController/isToolbarHidden] property. The toolbar also obeys the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIViewController/hidesBottomBarWhenPushed] property of the currently visible view controller and hides and shows itself automatically as needed.

## Configuring custom toolbars

- **setToolbarHidden(_:animated:)**: Changes the visibility of the navigation controller’s built-in toolbar.
- **isToolbarHidden**: A Boolean indicating whether the navigation controller’s built-in toolbar is visible.
- **hideShowBarDuration**: A variable that specifies the duration when animating the navigation bar.
